text.section: This section applies to all licenses issued by the clerk of a circuit court other than those issued under Title 17 of the Business Regulation Article.

If a clerk fails to make an account to the Comptroller in accordance with subsection (a) of this section, the Comptroller shall:
Charge the clerk with the entire cost of blank licenses delivered to the clerk at the rate fixed by law; and
Immediately afterwards, direct a suit to be brought against the official bond of the clerk to recover the amount.
